title: Wedding turns into a nightmare after guest dies
text:
A wedding has ended in tragedy after one guest died and another was left injured after they were hit by a car while walking home from the celebration.

The pair were leaving the ceremony at around 11pm on Saturday when they were hit while crossing Victor Harbor Road in McLaren Vale in Adelaide's south.

South Australia Police said the 59-year-old woman from Allenby Gardens died at the scene.

A wedding has ended in tragedy after one guest died and another was left injured after they were hit by a car. A man, 59 (pictured), was taken to Flinders Medical Centre

A man, also aged 59, was taken to Flinders Medical Centre with injuries to his leg.

The 78-year-old Holden ute driver from Willunga was treated for shock by paramedics and taken to hospital.

He is assisting police with their investigation.

The 78-year-old Holden ute (pictured) driver from Willunga was treated for shock by paramedics and taken to hospital

'It's an absolutely tragic incident for everybody that's involved,' Mayor of the City of Onkaparinga Erin Thompson told 9 News.

'We sympathise with our community and we'll be working with our community to advocate to state government to ensure these roads are upgraded and made as safe as possible, as soon as possible.'

Locals have come forward and said the road is dark and unsafe.

Locals have come forward and said the road (pictured) is dark and unsafe

The accident is the second in the area this year after a 50-year-old woman was killed in March when her car hit a truck.

A Good Samaritan had to use a torch to direct traffic away from the crash site because it was so dark.

The latest accident brings the state's road toll up to 87, compared to 57 at the same time last year.
description: A wedding has ended in tragedy after one guest died and another was left injured after being hit by a car while walking home from the celebration.
authors: Charlotte Karp For Daily Mail Australia
